text: I was a kid who grew up in a very small
town called Mancos Colorado
I was I was bored a lot and so I was
always looking for to waste will really
learn what I like and when I was
fortunate came up with my kind of first
practical idea which was to create a
robotic hand controlled by a wireless
control glove so I started talking to
amputees all over the place about what's
good what's bad you know what they would
like to to see within this technology at
the time I had a couple of 3d printers
in my bedroom where I would pretty much
print 24/7 so that allowed for rapid
prototyping in rapid iteration where I
could make something print it out within
a day I'd see if it works or not and
then keep doing that until I have
something that really works and as
functional it was approached by a man
named Tony Robbins when I was 18 that
saw what I was doing actually through a
TED talk I gave and really saw an
opportunity to help take us to the next
level this technology was you know still
being produced in my bedroom but had an
opportunity to help people all around
the world and so together we partner
together the form of a company called
unlimited tomorrow so my goal of
everything I do is to help people my
goal is to get the technology to
everybody who needs it in the world to
making this technology really easy to
create but also really functional so the
product can really speak for itself
this can benefit from filming to
automation and in university settings
and things like that so you know there's
a lot of different opportunities
throughout this
